page.title: 09COLCHESTER OYSTERS-PREDATORS
page.content: The presence of oysters in the waters of the Pyefleet Channel has encouraged the spread of other wild-life in the area:the oysters natural predators! star-fish,limpets,oyster-catchers lobsters,crabs,even foxes can all break into the seemingly impregnable oyster-shell.The star-fish wraps its five limbs round the shell and maintains a relentless pull upon it until the exhausted oyster is forced to open.The limpet bores a hole through the shell.Lobsters and crabs have claws sufficiently powerful to smash the tough shell.Foxes and Oyster_Catchers can prise it open.Most dangerous of all has been Man,because it is his pollution of the water that has done greatest harm and changed the oyster from a standard food for the poor of Victorian England to the expensive delicacy of today.
